intro: Gomphrena rubra, commonly known as the red globe flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its compact, rounded inflorescences that are typically pink to red in color. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Gomphrena rubra is known for its drought tolerance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
